1.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy

2.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to turn aside , i.e. (literally) to depart, (figuratively) be perverse
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

3.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

4.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a family; also (from the sense of yoking or taming) an ox or cow
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

5.brief: concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lie (i.e. deceive), literally or figuratively
to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)

6.brief: to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)

7.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

8.brief: to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly

9.brief: properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
guilt; by implication, a fault; also a sin-offering
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or

10.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery

11.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish

12.brief: there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

13.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, to feel pain; by implication, to grieve; figuratively, to spoil
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity

14.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

15.brief: properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

16.brief: bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

17.brief: short (whether in size, number, life, strength or temper)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)

18.brief: to inherit (as a (figurative) mode of descent), or (generally) to occupy; causatively, to bequeath, or (generally) distribute, instate
to enclose; hence (in a friendly sense) to crown, (in a hostile one) to besiege; also to wait (as restraining oneself)

19.brief: to sink or depress (reflexive or causative)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an opening, i.e. door or gate

20.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

21.brief: properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!

22.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

23.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an earthen vessel; usually (painful) toil; also a pang (whether of body or mind)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

24.brief: properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly

25.brief: to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff

26.brief: fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

27.brief: fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, something dug, i.e. a (general) source (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female pudenda); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

28.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
properly, a dissolution; concretely, a ruin, or (abstractly) consternation

29.brief: properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
short (whether in size, number, life, strength or temper)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

30.brief: alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame

31.brief: to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

32.brief: bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

33.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

34.brief: rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

35.brief: to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
